page.title: 02West Ashey Farm 1 (sheep)
page.content: The{sheep}at the farm are Welsh ewes.These are chosen because they are very strong.Each ewe has two lambs. When we were there, 290 sheep were pregnant.Today (24th April 1985) 526 sheep were sent to Banbury market.The lambing only lasts a few weeks, and the lambs we saw were only a few days old. 10% of the lambs need help to be born.Dennis Burts, the farmhand, gets very tired having to go out every few hours to check them.He even has to go out at night. The sheeps' fleeces have to rise before they can be sheared in June.When the sheep need to be dipped (in Autumn) Dennis has to borrow the dip from the nearest farm.Last year 1000 sheep were dipped (CHAOS!).Luckily, Glen, the 4 year old collie, helped to sort things out.
